title: transfer news: Manchester United eye 'Boubakary Soumare as potential heir to Paul Pogba'
text:
Manchester United are planning a move for Lille youngster Boubakary Soumare should they lose influential midfielder Paul Pogba next summer, according to ESPN.

The 20-year-old has impressed in Ligue 1 this season and, with his contract expiring this summer, the Old Trafford side have sent scouts to track his progress.

A number of Champions League clubs have registered their interest in the France Under-21 international, whose rangy style has drawn comparisons with Pogba.

Boubakary Soumare has emerged as a potential transfer target for Manchester United

Soumare has featured for the club in the Champions League this season against Valencia and Chelsea.

To date, Soumare has made 40 league appearances since moving to Lille from Paris Saint-German in 2017.

He could be joined at Old Trafford by compatriot and fellow PSG academy graduate Moussa Dembele as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer considers options to bolster his attack.

Dembele has registered 26 goals in 56 games since moving to Lyon in 2018 from Celtic, and may be open to a return to England - where he played for Fulham - in January.
description: Manchester United are planning a move for Lille youngster Boubakary Soumare should they lose influential midfielder Paul Pogba next summer, according to ESPN.
